jobs.title: Software Engineer (Proposal Cloud)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

GovDash is an AI company helping businesses find, win, and manage government contracts. Our platform automates business development, capture, proposal, and contract workflows end to end. This helps contractors grow faster and better serve government missions.

Our small, talent-dense team includes engineers from Google, Lockheed Martin, and CACI, along with veteran proposal managers and capture leaders. This mix of AI talent and deep GovCon expertise uniquely positions us to redefine how contractors work.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.


About this role

We’re hiring a full stack software engineer to join the Proposal Cloud Team at GovDash. Proposal Cloud is transforming how organizations craft, refine, and win government proposals by leveraging advanced AI to automate drafting, compliance checks, and reviews. We’re building the next generation of proposal automation, and we need engineers passionate about usability, quality, and impact.

In this role, you’ll:

  • Develop testing frameworks and curation tools that evaluate proposal quality and enforce clarity, compliance, and accuracy.

  • Build systems that intelligently update proposals as requirements change, keeping users confident they’re working with the latest information.

  • Create intuitive interfaces and feedback loops that help users understand, guide, and trust the AI—surfacing reasoning, highlighting errors, emphasizing citations, and tracking progress.

  • Collaborate with product and engineering teams to integrate user feedback, iterate quickly, and deliver high-impact features.

  • Own projects end-to-end, from design through deployment, ensuring every feature elevates the customer experience.

What we’re looking for:

  • Strong full stack development skills with TypeScript/Node.js.

  • Ability to work across both front-end and back-end systems.

  • Obsession with customer experience and usability.

  • Self-starter with ownership mentality who thrives in fast-paced environments.

  • Experience or strong interest in LLMs, embeddings, or agent-based systems.

  • Bonus: knowledge of government contracting.

  • Bonus: experience validating and evaluating LLM outputs for accuracy and quality.

Engineers at GovDash today:

  • Work with React (TypeScript), Node, Next.js, Temporal, and Large Language Models.

  • Move with speed and urgency without sacrificing quality.

  • Embrace difficult problems with excitement.

  • Put themselves in the shoes of our users to craft great experiences.

  • Value clear, frequent communication.

  • Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design.

  • Feel deep accountability and enjoy building for the businesses we serve.

You might thrive in this role if you have:

  • 2+ years of professional work experience.

  • Experience scaling a platform that serves web and/or enterprise apps.

  • Strong CS fundamentals and architectural instincts.

  • Bonus points if you’ve worked with LLMs, embeddings, or AI-powered applications.

  • A passion for customer experience and product ownership.

  • Excitement about building intelligent systems that help organizations win more business.

  • Care about America and her interests (non-negotiable).

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Account Management team has a unique mission to help make government contractors more successful in their pursuits.

GovDash (launched October 2023) is being rapidly adopted by companies across the country to redefine how their capture, proposal and contract teams go after opportunities. It assists government contractors with capture, proposal development, contract management & more—in one place.


You will be responsible for building relationships with potential clients, helping them with onboarding and training, and keeping them engaged so that they can best leverage GovDash to win more contracts. 

In this role, you'll:

  • Become a product expert across our entire platform and understand how GovDash can be used to run workflows across capture, proposal development and contract management.

  • Work with account executives to onboard new clients.

  • Train clients during their pilots so that they are successful, resulting in conversion.

  • Run general training sessions with the client base.

  • Share feedback from customer calls with product and engineering teams.

  • Maintain and update accurate records in CRM.

You might thrive in this role if you have: 

  • 2+ years of proposal development or capture experience.

  • Experience running demos of software products.

  • Experience training others on proposal workflows.

  • An understanding of government contracting, today's AI landscape, our products, and the problems they solve for our customers.

  • The ability to thrive in ambiguity and work autonomously.

  • Have fantastic communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple way.

  • Exceptional organizational skills.

  • The ability to operate with high horsepower, be adept at frequent context switching and working on multiple customer accounts at once, and ruthless prioritization.

  • Care about America and her interests.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Capture Cloud)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

GovDash is an AI company helping businesses find, win, and manage government contracts. Our platform automates business development, capture, proposal, and contract workflows end to end. This helps contractors grow faster and better serve government missions.

Our small, talent-dense team includes engineers from Google, Lockheed Martin, and CACI, along with veteran proposal managers and capture leaders. This mix of AI talent and deep GovCon expertise uniquely positions us to redefine how contractors work.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.

About the role:

We’re looking for a backend-leaning software engineer to join the Capture Cloud Team, specifically working with Bid Match (our opportunity search and recommendation engine). You’ll work closely with engineering and product teammates to expand our data sources, improve recommendation logic, and ensure our government data corpus is clean, normalized, and ready for analysis.

In this role, you'll:

  • Build and maintain backend services that power Bid Match, with a focus on scalability and reliability.

  • Scrape, ingest, and integrate new government data sources into our platform.

  • Refine and tune our recommendation engine to maximize accuracy and relevance.

  • Develop tools to normalize, sanitize, and manage large volumes of government data.

  • Collaborate with product and engineering teams to define and deliver data-driven features.


What we're looking for:

  • Strong backend development skills in TypeScript/Node.js.

  • Experience with web scraping and data integration.

  • Comfort working with large, messy, real-world datasets.

  • Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

  • Interest in recommendation systems or data science (bonus points).

  • Knowledge of government contracting data or other public-sector data sources (bonus points).



Engineers at GovDash today:

  • Work with React (TypeScript), Node, Next.js, Temporal, and Large Language Models.

  • Embrace difficult problems with excitement.

  • Put themselves in the shoes of our users to craft a great experience.

  • Value clear, frequent communication.

  • Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design.

  • Feel a deep sense of accountability and enjoy building for the businesses we serve.

You might thrive in this role if you have:

  • 2+ years of professional work experience.

  • Experience building a large-scale platform for web and mobile apps

  • Strong CS knowledge.

  • Bonus points if you’ve previously worked with large language models.

  • You care about product ownership and solving problems for our customers.

  • You’re passionate about being in a product-focused environment where everyone cares deeply about customer impact.

  • Care about America and her interests (non-negotiable)

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

GovDash is an AI company helping businesses find, win, and manage government contracts. Our platform automates business development, capture, proposal, and contract workflows end to end. This helps contractors grow faster and better serve government missions.

Our small, talent-dense team includes engineers from Google, Lockheed Martin, and CACI, along with veteran proposal managers and capture leaders. This mix of AI talent and deep GovCon expertise uniquely positions us to redefine how contractors work.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.

About the Role

We’re looking for a product designer with strong taste to work directly with engineers to make complex workflows feel simple across GovDash. You should care about how AI fits into product experiences and know how to create a consistent, cohesive design across product areas.

You’ll work with the CEO and engineering team to shape the product and set the design culture at a company solving a massive, underserved problem.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead design for core product initiatives across our capture, proposal and contract clouds

  • Collaborate with engineering to define scope, user flows, and UX patterns

  • Build and maintain a design system that balances speed with scalability

  • Conduct user research with customers to validate assumptions and refine solutions

  • Translate ambiguous problems into structured, elegant and simple interfaces

  • Ship fast, iterate based on feedback, and own outcomes

What We’re Looking For

  • 3+ years of experience designing B2B SaaS or workflow-heavy products

  • Strong portfolio showing UX thinking, systems design, and visual polish

  • Comfortable working in Figma and collaborating closely with engineers

  • Bias toward action and clarity - can make decisions with incomplete information

  • Experience in early-to-mid stage startups

  • Bonus: familiarity with govtech, compliance, or AI/ML interfaces (not required)

Why Join Us

  • High ownership: You’ll shape the product and user experience from the ground up

  • Speed: We ship weekly and iterate fast

  • Impact: Our customers are mission-critical businesses with real-world needs

  • Culture: Transparent, ambitious, and execution-focused

  • Equity: Meaningful ownership in a venture-backed company

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.

About the Role:

Our Sales team has a unique mission to help make government contractors aware of the deep impact that GovDash's platform can have on their ability to win and manage contracts.

We’re hiring a high-energy SDR to book qualified meetings with government contractors who will benefit from GovDash. The role is simple: start conversations, qualify leads, and get meetings on the calendar.


What You’ll Do:

  • Be the first touchpoint for potential customers - driving awareness and interest

  • Qualify inbound leads and execute outbound campaigns (email, phone, LinkedIn, etc.)

  • Set up discovery calls for our Account Executives

  • Collaborate with Marketing and other GTM team members to refine messaging and outreach strategy

  • Maintain clean CRM data and help drive pipeline insights


You Might Be a Fit If You:

  • Have 1–3 years of experience in an SDR, BDR, or Inside Sales role (bonus if SaaS)

  • Are a strong communicator: clear, persuasive, and curious

  • Located in or around the DC Metro area

  • Understand the government contracting space

  • Love learning, testing new ideas, and moving quickly

  • Thrive in fast-paced environments and want real ownership

  • Want to jump start your career in sales

  • Are energized by building something from the ground up


Why Join GovDash?

  • Be part of a fast-growing startup transforming the government contracting space.

  • Collaborate with a passionate, innovative team.

  • Competitive salary, equity options, and benefits.

  • Flexible work environment

  • Opportunity to make a direct impact on the company’s growth and success.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Dash)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

GovDash is an AI company helping businesses find, win, and manage government contracts. Our platform automates business development, capture, proposal, and contract workflows end to end. This helps contractors grow faster and better serve government missions.

Our small, talent-dense team includes engineers from Google, Lockheed Martin, and CACI, along with veteran proposal managers and capture leaders. This mix of AI talent and deep GovCon expertise uniquely positions us to redefine how contractors work.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.

About the role:

We’re hiring a full stack software engineer to join the Dash Team at GovDash. Dash is our AI teammate that orchestrates sub-agents to solve customers’ hardest and most mundane problems. It powers custom, ad-hoc automations that research, write, analyze, and execute work directly inside customer workflows.

In this role, you’ll:

  • Build and scale Dash’s orchestration layer to coordinate many smaller AI agents.

  • Develop agents that autonomously execute workflows on behalf of users.

  • Build data retrieval pipelines using embeddings to search and reason across thousands of documents.

  • Create custom research and document flows that generate business papers.

  • Enhance scraping pipelines to surface precise, actionable insights.

  • Develop the Word Assistant, a Microsoft add-in that embeds Dash directly into Word.

  • Own projects end-to-end with a relentless focus on customer experience.

What we’re looking for:

  • Strong full stack development skills with TypeScript/Node.js.

  • Ability to work across front-end and back-end systems.

  • Obsession with customer experience and ownership mentality.

  • Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.

  • Experience or strong interest in LLMs, embeddings, and agent-based systems.

  • Bonus: knowledge of government contracting.

Engineers at GovDash today:

  • Work with React (TypeScript), Node, Next.js, Temporal, and Large Language Models.

  • Move with speed and urgency without sacrificing quality.

  • Embrace difficult problems with excitement.

  • Put themselves in the shoes of our users to craft great experiences.

  • Value clear, frequent communication.

It powers custom, ad-hoc automations that research, write, analyze, and execute work directly inside customer workflows.

In this role, you’ll:

 - Build and scale Dash’s orchestration layer to coordinate many smaller AI agents.

 - Develop agents that autonomously execute workflows on behalf of users.

 - Build data retrieval pipelines using embeddings to search and reason across thousands of documents.

 - Create custom research and document flows that generate business papers.

 - Enhance scraping pipelines to surface precise, actionable insights.

 - Develop the Word Assistant, a Microsoft add-in that embeds Dash directly into Word.

 - Own projects end-to-end with a relentless focus on customer experience.

What we’re looking for:

 - Strong full stack development skills with TypeScript/Node.js.

 - Ability to work across front-end and back-end systems.

 - Obsession with customer experience and ownership mentality.

 - Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment.

 - Experience or strong interest in LLMs, embeddings, and agent-based systems.

 - Bonus: knowledge of government contracting.

Engineers at GovDash today:

 - Work with React (TypeScript), Node, Next.js, Temporal, and Large Language Models.

 - Move with speed and urgency without sacrificing quality.

 - Embrace difficult problems with excitement.

 - Put themselves in the shoes of our users to craft great experiences.

 - Value clear, frequent communication.

 - Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design.

 - Feel deep accountability and enjoy building for the businesses we serve.

You might thrive in this role if you have:

 - 2+ years of professional work experience.

 - Experience scaling a platform that serves web and/or enterprise apps.

 - Strong CS fundamentals and architectural instincts.

 - Bonus points if you’ve worked with LLMs, embeddings, or AI-powered applications.

 - Passion for customer experience and product ownership.

 - Excitement about building AI systems of systems where agents coordinate to get real work done.

 - Care about America and her interests (non-negotiable).

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Infrastructure)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are building the rails to do business with the government.

GovDash is an AI company helping businesses find, win, and manage government contracts. Our platform automates business development, capture, proposal, and contract workflows end to end. This helps contractors grow faster and better serve government missions.

Our small, talent-dense team includes engineers from Google, Lockheed Martin, and CACI, along with veteran proposal managers and capture leaders. This mix of AI talent and deep GovCon expertise uniquely positions us to redefine how contractors work.

In just 12 months, GovDash has scaled to millions in ARR and become the platform of choice for contractors nationwide. We are now building an AI-first ERP for government contractors and, ultimately, the most powerful procurement platform ever created. Join us.

About the role:

We’re looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to join our team and own the design, deployment, and management of container orchestration systems at scale. You’ll work across both our multi-tenant cloud and customer-hosted deployments, supporting high-impact government and defense projects. You’ll collaborate with engineers, security teams, and DevSecOps specialists to make our infrastructure reliable, secure, and automated.

In this role, you’ll:

  • Architect and manage Kubernetes clusters using Helm, Cilium, and other CNCF tools.

  • Operate and troubleshoot clusters in tightly controlled, airgapped, and regulated environments.

  • Support customers deploying GovDash in their own Kubernetes infrastructure (beyond EKS/AKS/GKE).

  • Deploy and operate stateful services in Kubernetes, including Elastic Cloud for Kubernetes and CloudNativePG.

  • Support hardened containers on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

  • Automate infrastructure with GitOps, CI/CD pipelines, policy enforcement, logging, and observability.

What we’re looking for:

  • 3–5+ years managing Kubernetes-based infrastructure in production.

  • Strong experience with Helm, Cilium, and core Kubernetes APIs.

  • Hands-on experience in airgapped or heavily firewalled networks.

  • Proven ability managing self-hosted Kubernetes clusters.

  • Experience running stateful workloads in Kubernetes (Elastic, PostgreSQL, etc.).

  • Familiarity with container networking and zero-trust principles.

  • Experience with IaC tools (Pulumi, ArgoCD, etc.).

  • Azure/AKS experience is a strong plus.


Bonus points if you have:

  • Familiarity with FedRAMP, CMMC, DoD IL5/IL6.

  • Experience with SBOMs, container scanning, and supply chain hardening.

  • Knowledge of SIEM tools (DataDog) and eBPF-based monitoring.


Engineers at GovDash today:

  • Work with React (TypeScript), Node, Next.js, Temporal, Kubernetes, and Large Language Models.

  • Embrace difficult problems with excitement.

  • Put themselves in the shoes of our users to craft great experiences.

  • Value clear, frequent communication.

  • Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design.

  • Feel a deep sense of accountability and enjoy building for the businesses we serve.

You might thrive in this role if you have:

  • 3–5+ years of professional experience running Kubernetes in production.

  • Experience in both cloud and self-hosted deployments.

  • A strong security mindset and familiarity with regulated environments.

  • Interest in infrastructure automation and building resilient, scalable systems.

  • Care about product ownership and solving problems for mission-critical customers.

  • Care about America and her interests (non-negotiable).
